citations.narrative:
**During a review of animal records it was noted that on 6/15/2022 at approximately 3:30 p.m., an 11 year old female
baboon, #PA9308, was found to be in distress in the enclosure. The animal was exhibiting open mouth breathing,
moderate ataxia and appeared to be severely dehydrated. Treatment was initiated for a period of 5 days, however, due to
an increase in severity of clinical signs, the animal was euthanized. The cause of dehydration was determined to be a
water valve malfunction. Potable water should be provided in sufficient quantities to the non human primates housed in
the facility. It is the responsibility of the facility to ensure that potable water is provided in sufficient quantities to the
animals housed at the facility as set forth in this section.
Correct from this date April 10, 2023

**Four naked mole rats were found deceased in their enclosures on August 3, 2022. No food was found in the animal
enclosures. Necropsy findings indicated the animals did not have access to food. Animals should be fed on a daily basis
in order to maintain the health of the animal. It is the responsibility of the facility to ensure the animals are being fed
wholesome and palatable food on a daily basis in order to promote the health of the animal as set forth in this section.
Correct from this date: April 10, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Attending Veterinarian and facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.83  Critical
   
Watering. 
**During a review of animal records it was noted that on 6/15/2022 at approximately 3:30 p.m., an 11 year old female 
baboon, #PA9308, was found to be in distress in the enclosure.  The animal was exhibiting open mouth breathing, 
moderate ataxia and appeared to be severely dehydrated.  Treatment was initiated for a period of 5 days, however, due to 
an increase in severity of clinical signs, the animal was euthanized.  The cause of dehydration was determined to be a 
water valve malfunction.  Potable water should be provided in sufficient quantities to the non human primates housed in 
the facility.  It is the responsibility of the facility to ensure that potable water is provided in sufficient quantities to the 
animals housed at the facility as set forth in this section. 
Correct from this date April 10, 2023 
3.129(a)  Critical
   
Feeding. 
**Four naked mole rats were found deceased in their enclosures on August 3, 2022.  No food was found in the animal 
enclosures.  Necropsy findings indicated the animals did not have access to food.  Animals should be fed on a daily basis 
in order to maintain the health of the animal.  It is the responsibility of the facility to ensure the animals are being fed

wholesome and palatable food on a daily basis in order to promote the health of the animal as set forth in this section. 
Correct from this date: April 10, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Attending Veterinarian and facility representatives.
